alert.note: Alert for Eastern Rutland; Orange; Western Rutland; Windsor (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued March 12 at 3:42AM EST until March 13 at 1:00AM EST by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 AM EST SUNDAY... * WHAT...Heavy wet snow. Total snow accumulations of 7 to 12 inches. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph, mainly this afternoon through Sunday morning. * WHERE...Eastern Rutland, Western Rutland, Orange and Windsor Counties. * WHEN...From 10 PM this evening to 1 AM EST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Heavy wet snow, possibly mixed with rain at the onset is expected across portions of south central Vermont this morning but will begin to transition to a drier snow this afternoon. Snow will become moderate to periodically heavy at times with snowfall rates in excess of 1 inch per hour possible this afternoon. Snow will taper off this evening and come to an end by Sunday morning. In addition, gusty northwest winds up to 45 mph will develop this afternoon and continue into the overnight hours. Blowing snow may develop and significantly reduce visibility across the region.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. Please allow extra time if travel is necessary.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Rutland; Orange; Western Rutland; Windsor
